abstract: Protests in Ethiopian region of Oromia prompt government crackdown that Human Rights Watch says has killed hundreds of civilians; activists say government has marginalized Oromo ethnic group in push to develop economy, which has seen substantial growth; officials say government's response was proportional.

headline.print_headline: Lethal Government Force Paralyzes an Ethiopian Region
headline.main: Lethal Government Force Brings Ethiopian Region to Fearful Standstill

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Since protests erupted in the Oromia region seven months ago, more than 400 people, almost all civilians, have died, according to a Human Rights Watch report.
lead_paragraph: Since protests erupted in the Oromia region seven months ago, more than 400 people, almost all civilians, have died, according to a Human Rights Watch report.
